alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... WEST CENTRAL RICHMOND...NORTHWESTERN NEW KENT...SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER...KING WILLIAM AND CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Newtown to Aylett to near Tunstall. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Saint Stephens Church, Newtown, Manquin, Tunstall, and Aylett around 850 PM EDT. King William around 900 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Beazley, Enfield, Upright, Cohoke, Westwood, Rose Garden, Biscoe, Crouch, Globe, and Palls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
